intro: Elatostema merrillii, commonly known as the small-leaved elatostema, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Elatostema merrillii is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including China and Malaysia. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
